wikipedia_page.main: Major Herbert Augustine Carter VC (26 May 1874 – 13 January 1916) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces. He was the son of the vicar of St Erth in Cornwall and served in two campaigns in East Africa.

response: * Major Herbert Augustine Carter VC (1874 – 1916) son of the vicar of St Erth. Served in two campaigns in East Africa.Mee, Arthur (1937) Cornwall. London: Hodder & Stoughton; p. 213 He is buried at St Erth in a plot planted with tropical plants including laurels and castor oil plants.Mee (1937); p. 250 His Victoria Cross is displayed at the Duke of Cornwall's Light Infantry Museum at Bodmin.
